push both of the battery release latches toward each other .

Lines.Text: lift the battery out of the mini 1000 from the edge closest to the release latches .

Lines.Text: remove the following two screws :
one 6 mm phillips screw
one 4 mm phillips screw

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the following two screws: One 6 mm Phillips screw One 4 mm Phillips screw

Lines.Text: to facilitate the removal of the keyboard , it is recommended to push the keyboard outwards with one hand through the opening ( highlighted in the third picture ) located on the backside of the mini 1000.
while pushing through the opening with one hand , grasp the left upper edge with the other hand and slightly pull the keyboard towards you .
once an opening has been established , grasp the keyboard and slowly lift it upwards along the upper perimeter of the top edge .

Steps.Text_raw: To facilitate the removal of the keyboard, it is recommended to push the keyboard outwards with one hand through the opening (highlighted in the third picture) located on the backside of the Mini 1000. While pushing through the opening with one hand, grasp the left upper edge with the other hand and slightly pull the keyboard towards you. Once an opening has been established, grasp the keyboard and slowly lift it upwards along the upper perimeter of the top edge.

Lines.Text: lift the keyboard out of the upper case , minding the cable that is still connecting it to the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the keyboard out of the upper case, minding the cable that is still connecting it to the motherboard.

Lines.Text: use your fingernail or the flat end of a spudger to flip up the retaining flap on the keyboard cable zif socket .
be sure you are prying up on the retaining flap , '''not''' the socket itself .
pull the cable out of its socket and remove the keyboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Use your fingernail or the flat end of a spudger to flip up the retaining flap on the keyboard cable ZIF socket. Be sure you are prying up on the retaining flap, '''not''' the socket itself. Pull the cable out of its socket and remove the keyboard.

Lines.Text: use your fingernail or the flat end of a spudger to flip up the retaining flap on the sim card ribbon cable zif socket .
be sure you are prying up on the retaining flap , '''not''' the socket itself .
pull the sim card ribbon cable out of its socket and peel it off the top of the hard drive enclosure .

Steps.Text_raw: Use your fingernail or the flat end of a spudger to flip up the retaining flap on the SIM card ribbon cable ZIF socket. Be sure you are prying up on the retaining flap, '''not''' the socket itself. Pull the SIM card ribbon cable out of its socket and peel it off the top of the hard drive enclosure.

Lines.Text: use your fingernail or the flat end of a spudger to flip up the retaining flap on the hard drive cable zif socket .
be sure you are prying up on the retaining flap , '''not''' the socket itself .

Steps.Text_raw: Use your fingernail or the flat end of a spudger to flip up the retaining flap on the hard drive cable ZIF socket. Be sure you are prying up on the retaining flap, '''not''' the socket itself.

Lines.Text: remove the two 4.5 mm phillips screws securing the hard drive to the lower case .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two 4.5 mm Phillips screws securing the hard drive to the lower case.

Lines.Text: lift the hard drive up and out of the lower case , being careful not to damage its cable in the process .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the hard drive up and out of the lower case, being careful not to damage its cable in the process.

Lines.Text: using the sharp tip of a spudger , pry and remove the four plastic screw covers from the underside of the hp mini 1000.
there are three different variations of the covers :
the two bottom covers are short in height and are notched to prevent incorrect insertion
the upper right cover is taller in height and is notched .
the upper left cover is taller in height and is not notched .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the sharp tip of a spudger, pry and remove the four plastic screw covers from the underside of the HP Mini 1000. There are three different variations of the covers: The two bottom covers are short in height and are notched to prevent incorrect insertion The upper right cover is taller in height and is notched. The upper left cover is taller in height and is not notched.

Lines.Text: remove the four 7 mm phillips screws that secure the upper case to the lower case .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four 7 mm Phillips screws that secure the upper case to the lower case.

Lines.Text: flip the computer over and open the display .
remove the two 4.5 mm phillips screws securing the upper case to the lower case .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the computer over and open the display. Remove the two 4.5 mm Phillips screws securing the upper case to the lower case.

Lines.Text: wedge the flat end of a spudger in between the upper case and lower case near the bottom right corner of the display .
carefully pry and rock the spudger upwards to create a small gap between the upper case and lower case .
continue the previously described motion along the right edge of the upper case to release the clips securing the upper case to the lower case .

Steps.Text_raw: Wedge the flat end of a spudger in between the upper case and lower case near the bottom right corner of the display. Carefully pry and rock the spudger upwards to create a small gap between the upper case and lower case. Continue the previously described motion along the right edge of the upper case to release the clips securing the upper case to the lower case.

Lines.Text: repeat the same procedure as mentioned in the previous step to release the clips along the left side of the upper case .

Steps.Text_raw: Repeat the same procedure as mentioned in the previous step to release the clips along the left side of the upper case.

Lines.Text: grasp the upper case and carefully lift it slightly upwards , freeing it from any remaining clips .
the upper case is still attached via the touchpad ribbon cable that is connected to the motherboard . '''do not remove it completely just yet . '''

Steps.Text_raw: Grasp the upper case and carefully lift it slightly upwards, freeing it from any remaining clips. The upper case is still attached via the TouchPad ribbon cable that is connected to the motherboard. '''Do not remove it completely just yet.'''

Lines.Text: lay the upper case on top of the upper portion of the motherboard .
use your fingernail or the flat end of a spudger to flip up the retaining flap on the touchpad cable zif socket .
be sure you are prying up on the retaining flap , '''not''' the socket itself .
pull the touchpad ribbon cable out of its socket .
remove the upper case from the hp mini 1000.

Steps.Text_raw: Lay the upper case on top of the upper portion of the motherboard. Use your fingernail or the flat end of a spudger to flip up the retaining flap on the TouchPad cable ZIF socket. Be sure you are prying up on the retaining flap, '''not''' the socket itself. Pull the TouchPad ribbon cable out of its socket. Remove the upper case from the HP Mini 1000.

Lines.Text: push the sd card toward the inside of the computer to unlock it from the lower case .
pull the sd card out of the lower case .

Steps.Text_raw: Push the SD card toward the inside of the computer to unlock it from the lower case. Pull the SD card out of the lower case.

Lines.Text: if present , peel the sticker up off the top of the wi-fi board to reveal the wi-fi antenna connectors .

Steps.Text_raw: If present, peel the sticker up off the top of the Wi-Fi board to reveal the Wi-Fi antenna connectors.

Lines.Text: pry the wi-fi antenna connectors ( 2 total ) up off the wi-fi board .

during reassembly , remember to correctly connect the antenna cables to their respective terminals . the green labeled antenna is connected to the '''main''' terminal and the white labeled antenna is connected to the '''aux''' terminal .

Steps.Text_raw: Pry the Wi-Fi antenna connectors (2 total) up off the Wi-Fi board. During reassembly, remember to correctly connect the antenna cables to their respective terminals. Lines.Text: upon removing the phillips screw that secures the wi-fi board to the motherboard , the wi-fi board should pop up from its top side nearest the antenna sockets .
grasp the wi-fi board and lift it straight away from its socket on the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Upon removing the Phillips screw that secures the Wi-Fi board to the motherboard, the Wi-Fi board should pop up from its top side nearest the antenna sockets. Grasp the Wi-Fi board and lift it straight away from its socket on the motherboard.

Lines.Text: remove the two 2.5 mm phillips screws securing the heat sink to the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two 2.5 mm Phillips screws securing the heat sink to the motherboard.

Lines.Text: carefully lift the heat sink off the face of the motherboard and de-route the curved section from next to the fan .
before reinstalling the heat sink , be sure to apply a new layer of thermal paste to the cpu . we have a guide that makes it easy .
only apply a new layer of thermal paste to the face of the cpu . the cpu is the large processor located closest to the fan .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully lift the heat sink off the face of the motherboard and de-route the curved section from next to the fan. Before reinstalling the heat sink, be sure to apply a new layer of thermal paste to the CPU. We have a [guide|744|thermal paste guide] that makes it easy. Only apply a new layer of thermal paste to the face of the CPU. The CPU is the large processor located closest to the fan.

during reassembly , remember to correctly connect the antenna cables to their respective terminals . the red labeled antenna is connected to the '''main''' terminal and the blue labeled antenna is connected to the '''aux''' terminal .

Steps.Text_raw: Pry the WWAN antenna connectors (2 total) up off the WWAN board. During reassembly, remember to correctly connect the antenna cables to their respective terminals. Lines.Text: remove the single 3 mm phillips screw securing the wwan metal bracket and wwan board to the motherboard .
during reassembly , before securing the wwan board to the upper case , be sure the metal bracket is correctly placed ( as highlighted in the second picture ) .
be cautious of the metal bracket's displacement . it can easily become lost during disassembly .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the single 3 mm Phillips screw securing the WWAN metal bracket and WWAN board to the motherboard. Be cautious of the metal bracket's displacement. It can easily become lost during disassembly.

Lines.Text: use a pair of tweezers to pull the pram battery connector out of its socket on the motherboard .
pull the connector parallel to the face of the motherboard toward the fan side of the computer .
use the flat end of a spudger to pry the pram battery off the adhesive securing it to the motherboard .
remove the pram battery .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a pair of tweezers to pull the PRAM battery connector out of its socket on the motherboard. Lines.Text: use the flat end of a spudger or your fingers to disconnect the following cables :
speaker cable
microphone cable
fan cable
power cable
display data cable

do not lift the connectors up as you disconnect them from the motherboard . push the connectors out of their sockets parallel to the face of the logic board toward the display assembly . use extra care when disconnecting the display data cable , as its connector and socket are fragile .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the flat end of a spudger or your fingers to disconnect the following cables: Speaker cable Microphone cable Fan cable Power cable Display data cable Do not lift the connectors up as you disconnect them from the motherboard. Use extra care when disconnecting the display data cable, as its connector and socket are fragile.

Lines.Text: turn the power off and disconnect all cables and cords from the laptop .
place the computer on its top on a flat surface with the hinges facing away from you .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the power off and disconnect all cables and cords from the laptop. Place the computer on its top on a flat surface with the hinges facing away from you.

Lines.Text: slide the battery release latch to the left which is located on the right-hand side of the battery .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide the battery release latch to the left which is located on the right-hand side of the battery.

Lines.Text: tilt the battery away from you and lift out .

Steps.Text_raw: Tilt the battery away from you and lift out.

Lines.Text: using a phillips 01 screwdriver , remove the phillips pm2.55.5 screw on the service cover .
this screw does not come out of the service cover completely once loosened .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a Phillips #01 screwdriver, remove the Phillips PM2.5×5.5 screw on the service cover. This screw does not come out of the service cover completely once loosened.

Lines.Text: slide the service cover toward the front of the laptop .
lift the service cover to remove it from the laptop .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide the service cover toward the front of the laptop. Lift the service cover to remove it from the laptop.

Lines.Text: remove the phillips pm2.54.0 screw that attaches the optical drive to the laptop .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the Phillips PM2.5×4.0 screw that attaches the optical drive to the laptop.

Lines.Text: press the tab with a metal spudger that is located next to the screw to release the optical drive .

Steps.Text_raw: Press the tab with a metal spudger that is located next to the screw to release the optical drive.

Lines.Text: slide the disk drive out of the laptop .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide the disk drive out of the laptop.

Lines.Text: place the laptop on its top
remove the two screws that secure the keyboard to the laptop .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the laptop on it’s top Remove the two screws that secure the keyboard to the laptop.

Lines.Text: stand the laptop on its left side with its top open .
locate the circular opening in the optical drive slot .
using a plastic opener , press on the keyboard through this opening until it lifts the keyboard away .

Steps.Text_raw: Stand the laptop on it’s left side with it’s top open. Locate the circular opening in the optical drive slot. Using a plastic opener, press on the keyboard through this opening until it lifts the keyboard away.

Lines.Text: place the laptop on its back with the front facing you .
using a plastic opener , lift the back of the keyboard towards you releasing it from the lip that holds it .
you will hear slight popping noises as the keyboard separates .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the laptop on it’s back with the front facing you. Using a plastic opener, lift the back of the keyboard towards you releasing it from the lip that holds it. You will hear slight popping noises as the keyboard separates.

Lines.Text: the keyboard is still attached by two ribbon cables . lift the keyboard slowly during this step .
lift keyboard up and place upside down on laptop .

Steps.Text_raw: The keyboard is still attached by two ribbon cables. Lift the keyboard slowly during this step. Lift keyboard up and place upside down on laptop.

Lines.Text: release the connectors that attach the keyboard to the laptop .

Steps.Text_raw: Release the connectors that attach the keyboard to the laptop.

Lines.Text: remove the keyboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the keyboard.
